name: Samosa
history: Samosa is a popular Indian snack with a history dating back to medieval times. It's a deep-fried pastry with a savory filling, typically spiced potatoes, onions, peas, and lentils.
description: Samosa is a triangular-shaped pastry filled with a spicy mixture of potatoes and peas. It's a popular snack in Indian cuisine, often accompanied by chutney.

equipment.name: deep frying pan
equipment.description: Used for deep frying the samosas.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: Used for rolling out the dough.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Mix the flour, ajwain, salt, and 2 tablespoons of oil in a bowl. Gradually add water and knead to form a stiff dough. Cover and let it rest for 20 minutes.

instructions.title: Make the Filling
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, ginger, green chilies, and peas. Cook for a few minutes. Add mashed potatoes, garam masala, red chili powder, coriander powder, amchur, and salt. Cook for another 5 minutes. Add chopped coriander and let the mixture cool.

instructions.title: Shape and Stuff Samosas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a circle, cut it in half, and shape each half into a cone. Fill the cone with the potato mixture, seal the edges with water.

instructions.title: Fry the Samosas
instructions.description: Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Deep fry the samosas on low to medium heat until golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the samosas hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

tips: Ensure the dough is stiff for easy handling and to prevent the samosas from absorbing too much oil.
Frying on a low to medium flame helps to cook them evenly and make them crispy.
variations: Add paneer or minced meat to the filling for a different flavor.
Experiment with spices in the filling according to taste.

storage.shelfLife: Samosas are best consumed fresh but can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat in an oven or air fryer before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in an oven or air fryer until crispy.
presentationTips: Garnish with a sprinkle of chaat masala and serve with a side of sliced onions and lemon wedges.
